blog.name: ofstarsandfireflies
blog.title: Such little light in a world of darkness
blog.description: 27 F who's OTPs are Destiel and Ironstrange

body:
Just a thing I wrote

They looked down at the gauntlet, Tony’s eyes fixed on the orange Soul stone.
That’s where everyone was.
That’s where Peter was.
“Right.” He said to the silence around him, Banner and Rogers looking up at him, “Let’s do this.”
He reached for the gauntlet when Steve grabbed him and stopped him.
“Tony wait.”
“They’re in there Rogers I’m not letting them…”
“Let me.”
Tony stared at him.
“It will kill you.”
Steve smiled, “technically I should already be dead.”
Tony wrenched his hand out of Steve’s grip.
He’d been pushing Steve away every time they’d had a chance to talk, and now there was no time to exchange apologies.
“It’s ok Tony.” He heard him say, “I want to do this. I need to do this. Please let me.”
Tony couldn’t speak. He couldn’t breathe. He felt Banner touch his shoulder reassuringly, grounding him and bringing him back.
Everyone else was dead. And now Cap was sacrificing himself.
Tony nodded and Steve wasted no time in pulling the large gauntlet on his arm.
His face a picture of concentration, he clenched his fist, the orange stone lighting up.
There was an explosion of orange light as a large portal began to open.
Tony teared his eyes away from Steve, who was sweating and gritting his teeth as he struggled to keep the portal open, to look at it.
Someone.
Anyone.
Please come through.
Please don’t let his sacrifice be in vain.
Please.
A shadowy figure emerged from the portal.
Tony geared up his gauntlet in case they had opened the wrong portal when…
“Mr. Stark?”
Tony almost fell over.
How long had it been since he’d heard his voice?
Too damn long.
“Kid!” Tony choked out, flying forward.
“Mr. Stark!” Peter yelled happily as Tony flew at him, his arms wrapping around him as they flew up, Peter holding him just as tightly.
“Pete! Your safe!”
They landed admits the crowd of people streaming from the portal.
They’d done it!
They’d won.
They’d lost so much but had won in the end.
Tony was content to just hold onto the kid for all eternity when he felt a hand clasp him on the shoulder.
He turned to see Stephen Strange standing there beside him, smiling.
“You did it Tony. As I knew you would.”
Tony could only stare at him.
He’d known??
He’d known every shit thing that was going to happen and hadn’t told him??
His anger must have shown on his face because that hand was suddenly sliding off his shoulder.
Stephen was about to move away when Tony suddenly grabbed him and pulled him into the hug with the Spider kid.
“It’s good to see you Strange.”
Stephen was shocked by Tony’s reaction, but the warmth of him made him melt into the hug and he brought a hand up around Peter.
Tony was crying.
He had Peter back. He had saved everyone. And at the cost of so much.
Stephen wrapped an arm around him too and pulled them both in closer.
He’d been willing to sacrifice them for the stone, he’d been willing to die to protect it.
Now, looking at the two in his arms, he felt like he finally had something to live for.
He would protect them.
Their reality.
Their world.
So they could have the small moments like this one.
And it would be worth it.
All of it.

Hope you liked it, it’s been bouncing around in my head for a while!

Also if something like this doesn’t happen I’m leaving planet earth

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Breaking This Cycle
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2RvOprV

by JolinarJackson

Ned didn’t want Peter to feel guilty, as much as he sometimes wished that things would go back to how they used to be. Back to when he didn’t have to cross half the city to see his best friend, back to when they could be out in the open without Peter constantly on alert, without people harassing him. He wondered whether it would ever die down, whether there would ever be a point in time when people would stop caring.
He hoped for Peter’s sake it would come soon.

As Peter struggles with the negative side effects of becoming Tony Stark’s son, Tony still aims to be a better father than Howard ever was to him, all the while trying to reign in his fear of losing Peter to the system. Meanwhile, the new mayor decides to make New York the first US city to implement the Registration Act for enhanced humans and work closely with neighborhood vigilantes while he’s at it. His first target: The criminals using alien tech to rob ATMs in Queens and Brooklyn.

Words: 6076, Chapters: 1/3, Language: English

Series: Part 5 of Lights To Guide You Home

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences

by JolinarJackson

Ned didn’t want Peter to feel guilty, as much as he sometimes wished that things would go back to how they used to be. Back to when he didn’t have to cross half the city to see his best friend, back to when they could be out in the open without Peter constantly on alert, without people harassing him. He wondered whether it would ever die down, whether there would ever be a point in time when people would stop caring.
He hoped for Peter’s sake it would come soon.

As Peter struggles with the negative side effects of becoming Tony Stark’s son, Tony still aims to be a better father than Howard ever was to him, all the while trying to reign in his fear of losing Peter to the system. Meanwhile, the new mayor decides to make New York the first US city to implement the Registration Act for enhanced humans and work closely with neighborhood vigilantes while he’s at it. His first target: The criminals using alien tech to rob ATMs in Queens and Brooklyn.

title: Bet’s On, Stark #3
body:
College/Young!Tony Stark x Reader

(Part 1)  (Part 2)

Quick Note: I’m always so nervous whenever I upload a new part ‘cause I fear it’s not going to be as good as the previous one. I really hope that y’all enjoy it though. Also I’d like to thank everyone who’s been reading so far, I really appreciate it!!! :)

Summary: Y/N is your everyday average girl with super strict parents, so some of her guy friends decide to make a bet. Need I say more?

Warnings: My inexperienced writing, bad language, goes from 0-100 real quick

Word count: 2639 words

Making your way down the rest of the stairs over to the door where your parents and Tony now stood, you thought you were going to experience a proper panic attack. “I-I- He’s-I mean-” you stuttered nearing to everyone.

Luckily enough your mother decided to take hold of the situation and invited him into the kitchen for some tea, leaving you and your strict father behind.

“Y/N you know the rules, no boys until-” your father began scolding until you interrupted him.

“Yeah yeah, until I’m done with my studies and have started my career but daaad, he’s just a friend from college, he helps me with work” you groaned.

Hearing your mother’s laughter the two of you turned to look in the kitchen’s direction.

“We’ll talk about this later young lady” your father said in a firm tone before walking over to the kitchen to see what all the laughter was about.

Clearly embarrassed by the situation you decided to follow suit only to send daggers in Tony’s direction when he looked up at you away from your mother.

“What’s going on here?” Your father asked sans interest while making himself a cup of coffee.

“Oh honey, you’ll never guess. This boy is Howard Stark’s son! Isn’t that great?”

The new information about the boy in his kitchen only seemed to cause a frown to reappear on his face again. Your father couldn’t care less who he was, all he was was a distraction in his daughter’s life. “A big shot then?” He asked curtly.

“He’s a real charmer love, go easy on him” she smiled politely at Tony, only for him to return the smile.

“Tony can I’ve a word?” You asked clearly unhappy with the situation just as much as your father.

Besides, what on earth has he said to your mother to stop her from over-reacting over his presence?

“Why now, he’s good where he is. We need to get to know this friend of yours better right?” Your dad stepped in yet again.

This was a nightmare, your parents were about to question every little detail of Tony’s existence. One thing was for sure, you definitely weren’t going to get to go anywhere after all of this.

Reaching for your mother’s hand, Tony decided to take hold of it in both of his giving it a light pat in a friendly manner. “Mrs. Y/L/N, I apologise, I didn’t mean to offend any of you. I just thought that it’d be good manners for me to come in here in person and ask for your permission to bring your lovely daughter to the funfair.”

Your mother seemed to soak up his act like a sponge. Your dad on the other hand not so much.

“Absolutely not!” Your dad huffed.

“Honey, he’s a good boy! Is anyone else going with the two of you Tony?” Your mother continued, completely ignoring the look your father was giving her.

“Oh absolutely ma'am” he said sending her another one of his handsome smiles.

What was he playing at?

“Okay then, just make sure to have her back here no later than 10:00”

Your dad decided to let out another huff in disbelief but to no effect.

“I’ll make sure she’s in through the door before the clock even strikes ten” he winked as he began to get up. Walking over to you he made sure to stop shortly to turn and look at your parents one final time. “Thank you, it’s been a pleasure to meet you both”

With your mouth slightly agape you couldn’t believe that he managed to convince your parents, well your mother, to allow you to leave with him just like that.

“Well you’re always welcome to come around” your mother smiled.

“Absolutely not!” Your father interjected, but your mother was quick to silence him with a displeased look.

“Go on Y/N, have fun” she encouraged.

Giving you one of his proud smirks, Tony nudged you to walk with him towards the door.

Grabbing your jacket and a handbag you followed him out to his car.

Oh you were definitely in for a lecture when you got back.

“What the hell was all that about!?” You shouted as you slammed the car door.

Tony simply started the car and began to move off before replying. “Oh c'mon, I did you a favour. Now you can have guys over.”

Fiddling with the strap from your bag you let out a long sigh. “Tony you made it worse, I’m gonna be in so much trouble when I get back.”

Looking over at you briefly he raised an eyebrow “Oh really? Seemed like your mother quite liked me”

Ugh if it weren’t for the fact that he was driving you would’ve punched him in the arm. Without a perfect comeback ready to snap back at him you decided to relax in your seat and stare out the window.

“I can’t believe that out of all the guys in the area, my parents had to meet you first” you mumbled.

Snorting at your comment, he decided to ignore your dig at him. Only he couldn’t, within seconds it began to bug him.

“So what if I was the first? Unlike any of the other guys out there at least I wasn’t afraid to try” he retorted.

From his tone of voice, it seemed as if your words hurt him in a way. With a silence following after his comment, neither of you spoke again for the rest of the journey until you finally reached the funfair.

Mumbling a quiet ‘thanks’ you got out of the car and began looking out for your friends. 

Tony didn’t get out of the car for a while, he seemed to be deeply in thought with his elbow resting against the door. He remained still in his seat, rubbing his face with his hand.

Within minutes you managed to find your friends, laughing together over something as they headed towards where you stood.

Seeing them close by in his mirrors, the young adult finally decided to get out of the car.

“What’s everyone waiting for?” Amber beamed. “The funfairs that way” she beckoned towards the entrance.

Not having to hear much else, Alex was quick to walk over to you and Amber linking your arms in his own and leading you both towards the entrance.

You were ready to try and wriggle out of his link but decided to go with the flow instead. As you were pulled along you gave a quick glance back over your shoulder to look at Tony, who walked silently beside Josh and Kyle.

You really must’ve struck a nerve with him.

Grabbing your tickets, you stopped shortly after the main entrance, allowing everyone to catch up with you.  Taking in all the attractions you weren’t even sure where to start.

“So what’d you wanna try first?” Josh asked nudging you out of your daydream state.

However, before you even had the chance to respond, you were already being dragged away yet again, this time by Jay. 

“Nah ah we get her first. C’mon Y/N” Amber remarked.

The three of you headed towards the bumper cars first for a simple beginning to an entire evening of fun. Handing in your ticket you went in to sit in the first car closest to you. The other two girls got into theirs, competitive faces already surfacing.

“You’re going down Y/L/N!” Amber laughed.

You squinted your eyes at her, only to send her a slight smile afterwards. “Try me!”

Within seconds you were ready to go. At first you began by gathering speed and making sharp turns only to crash with all the force you’ve managed to gather into either one of your friends. The atmosphere was quick to fill with random shrieks and fits of laughter as the three of you continued in your task of clashing against the other. At some stages when you were ready to put your tactic in place they’ve managed to throw you completely off-guard sending you out to crash against other bumper cars.

Laughing away, you continued your mini-fight until the cars began slowing down indicating that the time was up. Standing up from the car, your leg got slightly caught up as you tried to get out causing you to trip up, earning yet another fit of giggles from your friends.

“That was planned” you reassured them, giggling along.

Walking beside the girls, your next stop was a mirror maze. The building in which it was held was rather small and you questioned whether it was worth using up your ticket on. Of course, they were quick to convince you yet again.

Heading in, the room seemed a little dark at first but the path was lit up well enough for you to see where you were going. The first ten minutes were all fun and games as you were sure you were headed the right way only to walk into a mirror end each time. After that, things were beginning to get a little claustrophobic.

“Eh girls, I got another dead end” you spoke up, unsure of where you were seeing your friends.

“Try walking towards me, we can try to figure it out together” Jay replied.

Walking around you kept trying to reach your hand out to wherever you thought you saw Jordyn only to hit your hand against a mirror each time. Deeply concentrated on finding your friend you almost screamed when you felt something grab hold of your shoulder.

“Chill, it’s only me” Jay laughed.

Taking a deep breath in and out you were ready to keep going.

“I’m pretty sure we’re walking around in circles.” You eventually uttered with worry evident in your voice.

“Say, Amber’s been quiet”

A short moment of silence followed until the voice of your third friend filled the small room.

“I found the exit!!!” she squeaked excitedly.

Jay and you were quick to snap into focus, trying to identify where your friend could possibly be standing. “Amber where are you?!” you called, continuing to feel mirrors as you walked on.

“Over here!” she shouted back.

Jay soon grabbed onto your sleeve and led you behind her. She seemed to be onto something.

“Keep talking Amber! I think we’re close” Jay called out as she kept moving.

It took you another ten minutes until you finally managed to reach Amber, but with the fresh air of the outside hitting your face you couldn’t be more thankful to be finally out of that small building.

Taking deep breaths of the fresh air, the three of you continued to make your way around the funfair, only to be met with the guys again.

“Would you look who it is” Kyle laughed as they reached you.

“Lemme guess, obstacle course?” Alex grinned.

You shook your head in response. “A mirror maze, don’t be misled by the building.”

The two guys just looked at each other with Alex slightly raising his eyebrow in a questioning manor, only for Kyle to shrug in response.

“We were just heading to the roller-coaster at the back, wanna join?” Josh asked stepping closer.

Agreeing to join, you all made your way down towards the roller-coaster. Standing in front of the structure you had to admit that you felt somewhat nervous at the sight of how tall it actually was up close.

With the nerves in place, you were the last one out of your friends to take a seat in one of the carts, only to realise that the only person left without anyone sitting beside him was Tony. If it weren’t for the fact that you were uncomfortable to sit on your own, you would’ve sat elsewhere since your little disagreement.

Sitting in awkwardly beside him, you tried to keep a little room between the two of you.

With your safety belts fastened, and a safety bar clicked in place the carts began to move slowly. As it moved slowly upwards, Tony could tell that you were beginning to feel anxious. Without saying anything to you he grabbed your hand in his to ease your worries.

You glanced at your hand in his a little surprised. It was such a simple yet caring gesture.

Feeling your cheeks heat up you decided to sneak a look at him, only to see him send you a reassuring smile, giving your hand a gentle squeeze before the carts reached the tipping point.

It was a strange feeling but you went along with it, only tightening your grip with the fear that followed on the way down the tracks.

During that entire ride, he didn’t let go of your hand once. If anything, your fear seemed to keep him quite entertained as you finally loosened up your muscles allowing your side to comfortably touch against his.

With the ride coming to an end, everyone was quick to hop out except for you. You remained sitting still trying to process everything that just happened.

Tony just grinned leaning into your side. “You can let go of my hand now sunshine”

Upon realising that you were still holding onto it, you were quick to release his hand from your grip. Feeling yet another blush coming along, you hurried after your friends.

Ignoring Amber’s teasing look, you decided to stand beside Josh instead.

“Man, you should’ve seen Jordy” Alex laughed, nudging the dark-haired girl earning an eye-roll in return.

A little embarrassed by your own fear earlier on you decided to quickly suggest toning it down a little with some ice-cream or so. It didn’t take much convincing for some of your friends to tag along with you. Kyle and Alex on the other hand told you they’d re-join all of you later after another adrenaline filled attraction.

You were more than happy to allow them to go on their own.

Walking behind everyone else towards the treats booth, you noticed Tony looking back at you every now and then. It almost seemed as if he were debating whether to go back over to you and talk.

Josh was quick to beat him to it though.

“Heyy you”

Raising an eyebrow you responded with a soft giggle “uh hey?”

“Slow down a lil, I gotta talk to you”

Slowing down your pace, you allowed distance to build up between you and the rest of the group. Hundreds of questions began to fill your mind in the process. What did he want to talk to you about? Was he going to make a move on you? Was it actually Josh who had the crush on you all along?

“Well?”

Looking over at the group in the distance he decided to stop in his tracks, only to turn his attention back to you. Taking a step closer to you he decided to lean in to whisper just slightly above you ear.

“I was thinking…”

“Yeah?…” you asked remaining still, trying to keep your breath even at how close he was.

“We’ve always been really close Y/N ever since I met you, and we certainly make a great team..” he continued. “… and I know that you know about the bet…”

What a snake!

Waking from your daydream you were quick to push him back slightly. Looking up at him, you proceeded to squint your eyes suspiciously. “Who told you?”

“Hey, easy. And you did, just now” he smirked.

“Ugh, you’re a jerk y’know that?” you groaned. “What do you want?”

“Oh nothing, just help me win the bet”

Taken aback by his request, you decided to take a short step away from him.

“Are you for real? There’s no way-“ 

“Consider this, I can always tell them that you know. Besides, I also know who has a crush on you..” 

“You wouldn’t dare…”

“Or would I?” he smiled, winking at you.

A/N: OooOOOoooh dramaaaa. What do you think is going to happen next? How do you think the guys will react to the news that Tony has already met the parents? What about last Halloween? Will Y/N get to play a game of her own since Josh knows things? Find out more in part 4! :)

Tag(s): @faith-in-dean @itsjaynebird @moistpotatobear @dark-night-sky-99

College/Young!Tony Stark x Reader

(Part 1)  (Part 2)

Quick Note: I’m always so nervous whenever I upload a new part ‘cause I fear it’s not going to be as good as the previous one. I really hope that y’all enjoy it though. Also I’d like to thank everyone who’s been reading so far, I really appreciate it!!! :)

Summary: Y/N is your everyday average girl with super strict parents, so some of her guy friends decide to make a bet. Need I say more?

Warnings: My inexperienced writing, bad language, goes from 0-100 real quick

Word count: 2639 words

Making your way down the rest of the stairs over to the door where your parents and Tony now stood, you thought you were going to experience a proper panic attack. “I-I- He’s-I mean-” you stuttered nearing to everyone.

Luckily enough your mother decided to take hold of the situation and invited him into the kitchen for some tea, leaving you and your strict father behind.

“Y/N you know the rules, no boys until-” your father began scolding until you interrupted him.

“Yeah yeah, until I’m done with my studies and have started my career but daaad, he’s just a friend from college, he helps me with work” you groaned.

Hearing your mother’s laughter the two of you turned to look in the kitchen’s direction.

“We’ll talk about this later young lady” your father said in a firm tone before walking over to the kitchen to see what all the laughter was about.

Clearly embarrassed by the situation you decided to follow suit only to send daggers in Tony’s direction when he looked up at you away from your mother.

“What’s going on here?” Your father asked sans interest while making himself a cup of coffee.

Mumbling a quiet ‘thanks’ you got out of the car and began looking out for your friends. 

Tony didn’t get out of the car for a while, he seemed to be deeply in thought with his elbow resting against the door. He remained still in his seat, rubbing his face with his hand.

Within minutes you managed to find your friends, laughing together over something as they headed towards where you stood.

Seeing them close by in his mirrors, the young adult finally decided to get out of the car.

“What’s everyone waiting for?” Amber beamed. “The funfairs that way” she beckoned towards the entrance.

Not having to hear much else, Alex was quick to walk over to you and Amber linking your arms in his own and leading you both towards the entrance.

You were ready to try and wriggle out of his link but decided to go with the flow instead. As you were pulled along you gave a quick glance back over your shoulder to look at Tony, who walked silently beside Josh and Kyle.

You really must’ve struck a nerve with him.

Grabbing your tickets, you stopped shortly after the main entrance, allowing everyone to catch up with you.  Taking in all the attractions you weren’t even sure where to start.

“So what’d you wanna try first?” Josh asked nudging you out of your daydream state.

However, before you even had the chance to respond, you were already being dragged away yet again, this time by Jay. 

“Nah ah we get her first. C’mon Y/N” Amber remarked.

The three of you headed towards the bumper cars first for a simple beginning to an entire evening of fun. Handing in your ticket you went in to sit in the first car closest to you. The other two girls got into theirs, competitive faces already surfacing.

“You’re going down Y/L/N!” Amber laughed.

You squinted your eyes at her, only to send her a slight smile afterwards. “Try me!”

Within seconds you were ready to go. At first you began by gathering speed and making sharp turns only to crash with all the force you’ve managed to gather into either one of your friends. The atmosphere was quick to fill with random shrieks and fits of laughter as the three of you continued in your task of clashing against the other. At some stages when you were ready to put your tactic in place they’ve managed to throw you completely off-guard sending you out to crash against other bumper cars.

Laughing away, you continued your mini-fight until the cars began slowing down indicating that the time was up. Standing up from the car, your leg got slightly caught up as you tried to get out causing you to trip up, earning yet another fit of giggles from your friends.

“That was planned” you reassured them, giggling along.

Walking beside the girls, your next stop was a mirror maze. The building in which it was held was rather small and you questioned whether it was worth using up your ticket on. Of course, they were quick to convince you yet again.

Heading in, the room seemed a little dark at first but the path was lit up well enough for you to see where you were going. The first ten minutes were all fun and games as you were sure you were headed the right way only to walk into a mirror end each time. After that, things were beginning to get a little claustrophobic.

“Eh girls, I got another dead end” you spoke up, unsure of where you were seeing your friends.

“Try walking towards me, we can try to figure it out together” Jay replied.

Walking around you kept trying to reach your hand out to wherever you thought you saw Jordyn only to hit your hand against a mirror each time. Deeply concentrated on finding your friend you almost screamed when you felt something grab hold of your shoulder.

“Chill, it’s only me” Jay laughed.

Taking a deep breath in and out you were ready to keep going.

“I’m pretty sure we’re walking around in circles.” You eventually uttered with worry evident in your voice.

“Say, Amber’s been quiet”

A short moment of silence followed until the voice of your third friend filled the small room.

“I found the exit!!!” she squeaked excitedly.

Jay and you were quick to snap into focus, trying to identify where your friend could possibly be standing. “Amber where are you?!” you called, continuing to feel mirrors as you walked on.

“Over here!” she shouted back.

Jay soon grabbed onto your sleeve and led you behind her. She seemed to be onto something.

“Keep talking Amber! I think we’re close” Jay called out as she kept moving.

It took you another ten minutes until you finally managed to reach Amber, but with the fresh air of the outside hitting your face you couldn’t be more thankful to be finally out of that small building.

Taking deep breaths of the fresh air, the three of you continued to make your way around the funfair, only to be met with the guys again.

“Would you look who it is” Kyle laughed as they reached you.

“Lemme guess, obstacle course?” Alex grinned.

You shook your head in response. “A mirror maze, don’t be misled by the building.”

The two guys just looked at each other with Alex slightly raising his eyebrow in a questioning manor, only for Kyle to shrug in response.

“We were just heading to the roller-coaster at the back, wanna join?” Josh asked stepping closer.

Agreeing to join, you all made your way down towards the roller-coaster. Standing in front of the structure you had to admit that you felt somewhat nervous at the sight of how tall it actually was up close.

With the nerves in place, you were the last one out of your friends to take a seat in one of the carts, only to realise that the only person left without anyone sitting beside him was Tony. If it weren’t for the fact that you were uncomfortable to sit on your own, you would’ve sat elsewhere since your little disagreement.

Sitting in awkwardly beside him, you tried to keep a little room between the two of you.

With your safety belts fastened, and a safety bar clicked in place the carts began to move slowly. As it moved slowly upwards, Tony could tell that you were beginning to feel anxious. Without saying anything to you he grabbed your hand in his to ease your worries.

You glanced at your hand in his a little surprised. It was such a simple yet caring gesture.

Feeling your cheeks heat up you decided to sneak a look at him, only to see him send you a reassuring smile, giving your hand a gentle squeeze before the carts reached the tipping point.

It was a strange feeling but you went along with it, only tightening your grip with the fear that followed on the way down the tracks.

During that entire ride, he didn’t let go of your hand once. If anything, your fear seemed to keep him quite entertained as you finally loosened up your muscles allowing your side to comfortably touch against his.

With the ride coming to an end, everyone was quick to hop out except for you. You remained sitting still trying to process everything that just happened.

Tony just grinned leaning into your side. “You can let go of my hand now sunshine”

Upon realising that you were still holding onto it, you were quick to release his hand from your grip. Feeling yet another blush coming along, you hurried after your friends.

Ignoring Amber’s teasing look, you decided to stand beside Josh instead.

“Man, you should’ve seen Jordy” Alex laughed, nudging the dark-haired girl earning an eye-roll in return.

A little embarrassed by your own fear earlier on you decided to quickly suggest toning it down a little with some ice-cream or so. It didn’t take much convincing for some of your friends to tag along with you. Kyle and Alex on the other hand told you they’d re-join all of you later after another adrenaline filled attraction.

You were more than happy to allow them to go on their own.

Walking behind everyone else towards the treats booth, you noticed Tony looking back at you every now and then. It almost seemed as if he were debating whether to go back over to you and talk.

Josh was quick to beat him to it though.

“Heyy you”

Raising an eyebrow you responded with a soft giggle “uh hey?”

“Slow down a lil, I gotta talk to you”

Slowing down your pace, you allowed distance to build up between you and the rest of the group. Hundreds of questions began to fill your mind in the process. What did he want to talk to you about? Was he going to make a move on you? Was it actually Josh who had the crush on you all along?

“Well?”

Looking over at the group in the distance he decided to stop in his tracks, only to turn his attention back to you. Taking a step closer to you he decided to lean in to whisper just slightly above you ear.

“I was thinking…”

“Yeah?…” you asked remaining still, trying to keep your breath even at how close he was.

“We’ve always been really close Y/N ever since I met you, and we certainly make a great team..” he continued. “… and I know that you know about the bet…”

What a snake!

Waking from your daydream you were quick to push him back slightly. Looking up at him, you proceeded to squint your eyes suspiciously. “Who told you?”

“Hey, easy. And you did, just now” he smirked.

“Ugh, you’re a jerk y’know that?” you groaned. “What do you want?”

“Oh nothing, just help me win the bet”

Taken aback by his request, you decided to take a short step away from him.

“Are you for real? There’s no way-“ 

“Consider this, I can always tell them that you know. Besides, I also know who has a crush on you..” 

“You wouldn’t dare…”

“Or would I?” he smiled, winking at you.

A/N: OooOOOoooh dramaaaa. What do you think is going to happen next? How do you think the guys will react to the news that Tony has already met the parents? What about last Halloween? Will Y/N get to play a game of her own since Josh knows things? Find out more in part 4! :)

“We’ll talk about this later young lady” your father said in a firm tone before walking over to the kitchen to see what all the laughter was about.

“Tony can I’ve a word?” You asked clearly unhappy with the situation just as much as your father.

This was a nightmare, your parents were about to question every little detail of Tony’s existence. One thing was for sure, you definitely weren’t going to get to go anywhere after all of this.

Your mother seemed to soak up his act like a sponge. Your dad on the other hand not so much.

“Absolutely not!” Your dad huffed.

“Oh absolutely ma'am” he said sending her another one of his handsome smiles.

What was he playing at?

“Okay then, just make sure to have her back here no later than 10:00”

Your dad decided to let out another huff in disbelief but to no effect.

“I’ll make sure she’s in through the door before the clock even strikes ten” he winked as he began to get up. Walking over to you he made sure to stop shortly to turn and look at your parents one final time. “Thank you, it’s been a pleasure to meet you both”

With your mouth slightly agape you couldn’t believe that he managed to convince your parents, well your mother, to allow you to leave with him just like that.

“Well you’re always welcome to come around” your mother smiled.

“Absolutely not!” Your father interjected, but your mother was quick to silence him with a displeased look.

“Go on Y/N, have fun” she encouraged.

Giving you one of his proud smirks, Tony nudged you to walk with him towards the door.

Grabbing your jacket and a handbag you followed him out to his car.

Oh you were definitely in for a lecture when you got back.

“What the hell was all that about!?” You shouted as you slammed the car door.

Looking over at you briefly he raised an eyebrow “Oh really? Seemed like your mother quite liked me”
